intro: Agathosma pseudimbricata, commonly known as the Cape aster, is a perennial shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, small, yellowish flowers. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is cultivated in gardens and used in traditional herbal remedies.
